tool_description: Coordinates regulatory submissions across multiple jurisdictions, managing parallel submission processes and harmonizing requirements where possible.

target_jurisdictions.description: List of target regulatory jurisdictions for submission

submission_type.description: Type of regulatory submission to coordinate

study_protocol_path.description: Path to the master study protocol document

preferred_lead_jurisdiction.description: Preferred jurisdiction to serve as reference for harmonization

parallel_submission.description: Enable parallel submission to multiple jurisdictions

harmonization_level.description: Level of harmonization attempt (minimal, moderate, maximum)

error_messages: Invalid jurisdictions: One or more specified jurisdictions are not supported
Insufficient jurisdictions: At least 2 jurisdictions required for coordination
Invalid submission type: Submission type is not recognized or supported
Protocol file not found: Study protocol path is invalid or inaccessible
Invalid lead jurisdiction: Preferred lead jurisdiction must be in the target jurisdictions list
Invalid harmonization level: Use minimal, moderate, or maximum
Jurisdiction conflict: Incompatible requirements detected between selected jurisdictions
usage: Specify target jurisdictions, submission type, and protocol path to coordinate multi-jurisdictional submissions with optimal harmonization and timing.

coordination_plan.description: Comprehensive plan for coordinated multi-jurisdictional submission

jurisdiction_requirements.description: Harmonized requirements across all target jurisdictions

submission_sequence.description: Recommended sequence and timing for submissions

harmonization_opportunities.description: Identified opportunities for document and process harmonization
